reviewText:
As of right now, this game isn't that great, but it should be easy for the devs to fix

Negatives
-You can't change the resolution, it's locked to what im guessing is 1028x768
-While selecting songs, there's no way to sort by genre
-Horrible English translation
-Pay2Dress
-No way to rebind the controls, you have to use autohotkey or a similar program if you want to use the aszx keys instead of the arrow keys when playing with a keyboard
-The notes are color-coded, but there's no colorblind option for folks that need it
-Speaking of which, there's no straightforward way to change the graphics used by the game. Seriously? It's 2016, there should at least be some modding capabilities.
-Notes have very little contrast in them, which means you pretty much have to rely on the color of the notes alone
-Upon entering fever mode, all notes have the same color, making charts quite a bit harder

Neutral
-In 8 key mode, diagonal note hits don't register properly, though this could just be my hardware
-It's 2016, do games seriously still need to force the gender binary onto players?
-Aggressively heterosexual gamemode options
-You don't actually have to hit any of the arrow notes on the beat, you just have to hit them in the proper order during the small timeframe you're given to hit them. On the other hand (literally,) space notes require precise timing
-Charts are chopped up into 1-2 line sections with pauses between every single one. It gets pretty annoying after the first couple of seconds
-It's pretty clear that the game is pretty dated
-None of the songs are very well known in the west
-All of the songs seem to be in English

Positives
-A diverse selection of songs featuring a lot of different genres, and a lot of them are surprisingly good
-Despite the gameplay being somewhat confusing at first, it's surprisingly simple and pretty good
-Runs above 500+ fps on a VERY low-end machine; Very optimized
-Plays pretty well with a DDR dance mat and TataCon controller combo

It definitely doesn't hurt to try it out, but it certainly isn't everyone's cup of tea

reviewText: LoveBeat is a Korean rhythm game much like Guitar Hero or DDR but utilize the arrow keys and spacebar for the controls. You are unable to bind keys so you're stuck with what you got. It's a multiplayer game so you can just play with other players randomly or with friends. The biggest con this game has are the in-game items for your avatar which can be bought with real money and are only available for a limited number of days. This way of getting money is really stupid because the price for in-game currency/items is overpriced and with the time limit makes it seem completely pointless. A second but more minor con is the songlist, and that is because it is small and majority or some people say the entire songlist just sucks because it's made up of generic dance songs or acoustic songs that are in Korean, Spanish, and English I believe. Also the graphics can be a con for some because just look at the screenshots/trailer and tell me if it looks like a 2015 game; looks more like a game from 2005. This can be good for some people since it'll be able to run on anything. The animations are smooth but can look iffy and one thing I dislike is that the animation for the models when dancing don't go along with the song and that can also be said for the actual gameplay itself with the arrow keys etc. Overall if you can look past the cons, mostly the in-game items, songs, and graphics then I would recommend it especially since it's free and takes a few minutes to download and install. Defo reccomend trying this game, it is really fun and i love Rhythm games (such as Audition Online) so i was deffinetely willing to give this game a go and so far, i am enjoying it! :) In LoveBeat, you use arrows and space like Audi but instead you press the arrows and/or space once a blue light hits that section (known as the devcision line) you get % for each section and a grade overall wow being the hightest and then cool,normal, bad, miss being the other grades to get.

There are a various selection of modes in this game such as: Team Surival, Meeting party (dance with each person and choose your couple though you need card to be actual one), couple dance, pass the bomb, non stop crazy etc. and of course, you have your normal individual mode too! :D

You can have couples here (same gender or not) and also groups known as FAMS on here and battle it out with other FAMS around the game which i must say, is really fun! It works like Team only its best out of 3 and it gives your FAM EXP and i imagine points towards your FAM's grade too! You can have up to 50 friends on this game too and you will make some prety fast as the community is pretty friendly here which is always a + with these type of games, not perfect though of course! :P

There is 1 or 2 downsides that don't make the game unplayable but one of them is, time limited clothing/items beats or cash, I can understand why not many people like this system, i wish we could have them for good too but the game being F2P, has to make its money somehow i guess XD +getting beats in this game seems pretty fast as you get a lot of beats for leveling up which can be found in the gift boxes you get! :)

The song list is pretty nice too, not all will appeal to you as everyone have different taste but songs like City Lights" and "In Tune" are nice ones and 2 of my faves on this game! :D All the songs are fun to try regardless as this game is all about having fun afterall

You should give this game a go and see how you get on
